title: General Metadata Tags — meta_general
text: .meta meta object created meta() as_meta(), returned meta_*() object. application_name Name web application (used website used app). theme_color Theme Color Chrome, Firefox OS Opera, e.g. "#00589a". description Short description document (limit 150 characters), content may used part search engine results. robots Control behavior search engine crawling indexing, e.g. "index,follow". Valid names "index", "noindex", "follow", "nofollow". May vector single string comma-separated values. See https://www.robotstxt.org/meta.html information. generator Identify software used build document (.e. - WordPress, Dreamweaver). subject Short description document's subject. rating Gives general age rating based document's content, e.g. "General". referrer Allows control referrer information passed, .e.g. "-referrer". Valid values include "-referrer", "-referrer--downgrade", "-origin", "origin", "strict-origin", "origin--cross-origin", "strict-origin--cross-origin", "unsafe-url".

Additional geotagging metadata keyword value pairs, geo.country, geo.a1, ..., geo.a3, etc. Underscores keyword converted periods, can also specify geo_country place geo.country.

code: meta_google_scholar(   .meta = meta(),   title,   author,   publication_date,   online_date = NULL,   journal_title = NULL,   conference_title = NULL,   volume = NULL,   issue = NULL,   firstpage = NULL,   lastpage = NULL,   pdf_url = NULL,   issn = NULL,   isbn = NULL,   dissertation_institution = NULL,   technical_report_institution = NULL,   technical_report_number = NULL )

title: Add Google Scholar Metadata — meta_google_scholar
text: .meta meta object created meta() as_meta(), returned meta_*() object. title title paper. title tag must contain title paper. use title journal book paper published, name repository. tag required inclusion Google Scholar. author vector author names. author tag, must contain authors (actual authors) paper. use author website contributors authors, e.g., thesis advisors. Author names can listed either "Smith, John" "John Smith". Put author name separate tag omit affiliations, degrees, certifications, etc., field. least one author tag required inclusion Google Scholar. publication_date, online_date date paper published journal (publication_date) published online (online_date). publication_date tag must contain date publication, .e., date normally cited references paper papers. use date entry repository - go online_date instead. Provide full dates "2010/5/12" format available; year alone otherwise. tag required inclusion Google Scholar. journal_title, conference_title, issn, isbn, volume, issue, firstpage, lastpage journal conference papers, provide remaining bibliographic citation data following tags: journal_title conference_title, issn, isbn, volume, issue, firstpage, lastpage. fields must contain sufficient information identify reference paper another document, normally : () journal conference name, (b) volume issue numbers, applicable, (c) number first page paper volume (issue) question. pdf_url <meta> tags normally apply exact page provided. page shows abstract paper full text separate file, e.g., PDF format, please specify locations full text versions using pdf_url. content tag absolute URL PDF file; security reasons, must refer file subdirectory HTML abstract. dissertation_institution, technical_report_institution, technical_report_number theses, dissertations, technical reports, provide remaining bibliographic citation data following tags: dissertation_institution, technical_report_institution name institution technical_report_number number technical report. journal conference papers, need provide sufficient information recognize formal citation document another article.

title: Write Metadata Tags to a File — write_meta
text: .meta meta object created meta() as_meta(), returned meta_*() object. path file write , defaults "meta.html". append logical. used argument file     name file (connection "|cmd").     TRUE output appended     file; otherwise, overwrite contents     file.

title: Write Metadata Tags to a File — write_meta
text: Returns .meta invisibly.

title: Write Metadata Tags to a File — write_meta
code: meta_html_snippet <- tempfile("metathis_example", fileext = ".html")  meta() %>%   meta_name("package" = "metathis") %>%   write_meta(meta_html_snippet)  readLines(meta_html_snippet, warn = FALSE) #> [1] "<meta name=\"package\" content=\"metathis\"/>"
